definition: to boss people around (idiom)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Shi
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
classifier for a ream of paper
see 令狐[Ling2 hu2]
see 脊令[ji2 ling2]
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: Margaret is calling the shots around our house these days.
sentences.chinese: 瑪格里特這幾天在我們家發號施令。

sentences.english: The victorious nations were able to dictate peace terms.
sentences.chinese: 戰勝國能發號施令地規定媾和條件。
他是個愛發號施令的領導。

sentences.english: The captain bawled out the orders.
Elijah then on Mount Carmel again takes charge. His first question was to the people.
sentences.chinese: 在迦密山上，以利亞再次成爲發號施令的人。

sentences.english: The goose took command and began to give orders.
sentences.chinese: 那隻母鵝當起了指揮，開始發號施令。

sentences.english: For the next few hours, I am the one who commands.
sentences.chinese: 接下來的幾個小時裏，由我來發號施令。

sentences.english: Cadres should go deep among the masses, not just sit in their offices issuing orders.
sentences.chinese: 幹部要深入羣衆，不要只是坐在辦公室裏發號施令。

sentences.english: Mr. Dempster appeared to be a man accustomed to exercise authority.
sentences.chinese: 登普斯特先生看來是一個習慣於發號施令的人。

sentences.english: He lorded it over his household.
Her father dictated and her mother obeyed.
sentences.chinese: 她父親發號施令，她母親惟命是聽。

sentences.english: He was giving orders, and people were taking them.
sentences.chinese: 他發號施令，人們惟命是從。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: power struggle
control
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
hunger strike
overbearing/arrogant bully
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to obstruct/to impede
to be reluctant to give up a post
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to become a mere formality
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
crafty/slippery/slyboots
